title: What is product-service bundling and what are the benefits to customers? - Quora

response.answer_text: In marketing, product bundling is offering several products or services for sale as one combined product or service package. It is a common feature in many imperfectly competitive product and service markets. Product or service Bundling is defined as combining two or more products/services with a reward benefit for the customer that takes up the combined product/service set. It sounds so simple to create product and service Bundles – combine some products into a package and give customers a discount for taking it up and the task is done. The result is higher revenue, lower operational costs and better profits, i.e. 1+1=3; the synergistic profitability impact. However, there are many unique issues in developing and implementing a bundling strategy that will ultimately drive success or failure. As bundling involves combining a range of products, it exacerbates the complexity and importance of resolving these issues and challenges in order to reap the potential profits from bundling. What appears to be a winning profit strategy could end up with disastrous results to a company’s bottom line if not managed correctly. Business Benefits Bundling is attractive to consumers who benefit from a single, value-oriented purchase of complementary offerings. Bundling helps to increase efficiencies, thus reducing marketing and distribution cost. It allows the consumer to look at one single source that offers several solutions.
